example[2]: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal  (=be fatal).
definition[1]: having a very bad effect, especially making someone fail or stop what they are doing
example[3]: Telling your employees they’re unimportant is a fatal error.
example[4]: Disunity finally proved fatal to the rebels’ cause.
example[5]: There was one fatal flaw  (=serious weakness) in his argument.
example[6]: His presidential hopes suffered a fatal blow in New Hampshire.
